pullRequest.body:
While the definition formally makes sense for a preorder,
this topology is usually not the right one for a non-linear order (e.g., `Real Ã— Real`).

See [Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Open.20Ioi)

---

This PR doesn't cleanup any API, I'm going to do it in a later PR.
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [050002948e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16348/commits/050002948e410cd64a645311e0f6c574cbb60f75)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (priority := 100) OrderTopology.to_BoundedGENhdsClass {Î± : Type*} [LinearOrder Î±]`
`+ instance (priority := 100) OrderTopology.to_BoundedLENhdsClass {Î± : Type*} [LinearOrder Î±]`
`- instance (priority := 100) OrderTopology.to_BoundedGENhdsClass [IsDirected Î± (Â· â‰¥ Â·)]`
`- instance (priority := 100) OrderTopology.to_BoundedLENhdsClass [IsDirected Î± (Â· â‰¤ Â·)]`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

The definitions still talk about `Preorder`s, because (a) this way Lean doesn't have to match `LinearOrder` instances for defeq, only `le` and `lt` fields, which should be faster; (b) we have a non-defeq diamond in `[ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder Î±] {s : Set Î±} [OrdConnected s] [Inhabited s] : ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder s`.
@YaelDillies Do you have time to write this warning? I'm bad at formulating stuff like this. If yes, then please push it directly to this branch. Thank you!

maintainer merge



> we have a non-defeq diamond in `[ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder Î±] {s : Set Î±} [OrdConnected s] [Inhabited s] : ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder s`.

Could you please say a bit more about this, maybe on Zulip?

maintainer merge



> we have a non-defeq diamond in `[ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder Î±] {s : Set Î±} [OrdConnected s] [Inhabited s] : ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrder s`.

Could you please say a bit more about this, maybe on Zulip?
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by urkud.

Yes that makes a lot of sense. I myself spent too much time trying to generalise order topology theorems to non-linear orders.

Could you please however add a big red flashing implementation note about why the definition is only made for linear orders?

Yes that makes a lot of sense. I myself spent too much time trying to generalise order topology theorems to non-linear orders.

Could you please however add a big red flashing implementation note about why the definition is only made for linear orders?

Please expand this a bit. A link to the zulip discussion would already help a bit.

But I think it would be even better if somewhere (here or on zulip and then link to it from here) there is a more detailed example of how the version with `Preorder` makes your life harder.

pullRequest.title: refactor(Topology): require `LinearOrder` with `OrderTopology`
